intro: Buphthalmum capense, commonly known as the Cape fritillary, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its yellow-orange petals are surrounded by a ring of pale yellow rays, creating a striking visual appearance. Buphthalmum capense is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and warm climates.
